intro: Baeumerta nasturtium, commonly known as the Indian cress, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard family plants. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often accompanied by heart-shaped, glossy leaves. Its seeds are edible and have a peppery flavor similar to that of mustard. Baeumerta nasturtium is often cultivated for ornamental purposes as well as for its culinary uses.
